intro: Racosperma poliochroum, commonly known as the silver-veined acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves with distinctive silver veins. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, globular clusters. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Racosperma poliochroum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
